ws.rocket.config.section.value

Class DefaultConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.config.section.value.DefaultConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueConverter

    public final class DefaultConverter
extends Object
implements ValueConverter
    Built-in support for value conversions from String to target runtime types.
    Target type Source interpretation
    long
    java.lang.Long    		 Long.valueOf(source)
    int
    java.lang.Integer    		 Integer.valueOf(source)
    short
    java.lang.Short    		 Short.valueOf(source)
    double
    java.lang.Double    		 Double.valueOf(source)
    float
    java.lang.Float    		 Float.valueOf(source)
    char
    java.lang.Character    		 First character of source
    byte
    java.lang.Byte    		 Byte.valueOf(source)
    boolean
    java.lang.Boolean    		 Boolean.valueOf(source)
    java.math.BigDecimal new BigDecimal(source)
    java.math.BigInteger new BigInteger(source)
    java.net.URI URI.create(source)
    java.net.URL new URL(source)
    java.lang.Class Class.forName(source)
    java.lang.Package Package.getPackage(source)
    java.util.Date Date value parsed using either of these formats:
    yyyy-mo-ddTh24:mi:ss
    yyyy-mo-dd
    Th24:mi:ss
    any other type an instance returned by calling the default constructor of Class.forName(source)
    Author:
    Martti Tamm

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        public Object convert(String value,
             Class<?> targetType)
               throws SectionValueException
        Description copied from interface: ValueConverter
        Converts given value to target type. When conversion fails, it should be logged in msgs.

        Normally, a converter should not be called to convert a null or empty string. However, implementations may handle that by returning null and/or logging a warning.

        Specified by:
        convert in interface ValueConverter
        Parameters:
        value - The source value.
        targetType - The target type as class (required). When an interface or abstract class, the source value should be considered a full name of a class to be instantiated that must be implement or extend this target type.
        Returns:
        The converted value. May be a null.
        Throws:
        SectionValueException - When the value has problems that blocked the conversion.
